title: Playing with 9-12 month infants!
content:
WHAT YOU CAN DO AND OBSERVE

- Play hide and sick with your infant and see if she/he can find the objects you hide. You can hide it under a cloth, and say: “where does it go”? “Is it still there”? “Can you find it”? 

> You should see your child’s curiosity increase and willingness to find out what happened to the object.

- Tell your infant the name of things and people you are referring to. 

> She/he should show interest and soon will try to make a relationship between words and objects or people.

- Show your child how to say things with hands, like “bye bye”. 

> Your child should soon try to imitate you and wave bye-bye on her/his own, making a relation between a movement and a vocal expression.

- Point to the eyes, nose and mouth on a doll. After showing one part on the doll, touch the same part on yourself and on the baby. Take the baby’s hand and have her/him touch the eyes, nose and mouth of the doll you, and her/himself. See the nose on the baby doll? Here is my nose and here is your nose. 

> You should see the baby’s curiosity increase. Slowly, baby will be able to memorize and identify these different words and make relationship with her/his body parts.
